config.question: Though affiliated within the American Federation of Labor, the Cigar Makers’ Union and the Typographical Union were unique from that larger organization in that they __________.

choices.content: required their members to pass literacy exams
prohibited Jews and Catholics from holding office in local union lodges
openly endorsed candidates in local and national political races

answer_3.response: The AFL either ignored or opposed women workers. Only two of its national affiliates—the Cigar Makers’ Union and the Typographical Union—accepted women members; others prohibited them outright. Founder Samuel Gompers himself complained that women workers undercut the pay scales for men.
